author: DaMattGuy

text: Agreed. Underrated yet awesome game. One of tri-Ace's strongest works in my opinion. I absolutely love the jazzy feeling of the soundtrack as well, and cite this as an example of how jazz should be done in videogames. This track is my favorite btw.
author: Now On AFM

text: This was certainly a memorable game. I thought it did a lot of innovative things for the genre. Radiata Stories is an underated gem.
author: Melchiorblade7

text: This game was just great to play and the music made it even better
author: GuardianofDTD3

text: Most of the soundtrack in this game is amazing.  For the most part, very upbeat and relaxing!  If any of you guys haven't played it, I really recommend it.
author: Ein

text: Also the game is beautiful. Just... Gorgeous
author: Jared Silvestri

text:
Completely agree. The only "bad" thing is that I wasn't really convinced by neither of the endings. Also, they should give more than a simple photo for recruiting everyone!

That said, it really excelled in pretty much everything else.

text: I speedrun this game! The music is super awesome!

author: LordRoto

text: I barely remember this game. Only played through it once before my PS2 died. I remember really liking how the overworld was set up, and really not liking how each progressively more powerful armor you got for the main character looked progressively more like a dress.
author: Uncle Al

text: I LOVED this game.  A real shame it wasn't more popular.

text: I love this game so dearly! Soooo good!
author: cobbil

text: LOVE this song, favorite in the game(though Song of Freedom Fighters comes close). Amazing game, with so much potential if it ever got a sequel(which is sadly unlikely). I'd say it actually makes my second favorite game of all time(right behind Chrono Trigger).
author: Arc13

text: So many memories (:
author: Yubs Rsc

text:
Wish i could like it. But damn...the main characters voice in battles make me go crazy.
And got dissapointed that you steer other party members.

Otherwise its nice.
author: Redfoxe

text: Loved this game to bits. Just like in Star Ocean 3:Till the End of time(made by the same developers, I believe), the game doesn't stop at defeating the final boss, no! You are only HALF way done when you do that! There is a super post-game dungeon(s) you can complete to fully challenge yourself and really get more bang for your buck. I wish there were more RPGs out there today that had this kind of mechanic for the RPG long-play lovers out there! Thanks for posting the song, Supra!
author: Tempest

text: One of the most memorable PS2 games I played. Those 3 characters are great, the humor is good and the whole aspect of each town's inhabitants having their own schedule make for a living world. It doesn't hurt that Iwadare composed a great soundtrack for it, I'm a very big fan of his.
author: SupraDarky
